intro: Urera baccifera var. horrida, commonly known as the rough urera, is a shrub native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its rough, hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically white or pale yellow, and it produces berries that are edible but have a bitter taste. This species is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along riverbanks.
